headline: Adobe raises annual revenue and profit forecasts on strong design software demand
summary: Adobe raised its fiscal 2025 revenue and profit forecasts on Thursday, signaling strong demand for its design software and increased monetization of its artificial intelligence tools. Shares of the San Jose, California-based company rose around 4% in extended trading. Adobe's offerings, including Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat and Illustrator, have become household names in design software, widely used by enterprises, students and creative professionals to edit, create websites, brochures and graphics.

headline: Adobe stock gets lift after Q3 earnings beat, raising outlook
summary: Adobe (ADBE) is getting a stock boost in extended hours trading at the time of this post after the creative software developer released fiscal third quarter figures that topped estimates— revenue of $5.99 billion (vs. expected $5.91 billion) and adjusted earnings of $5.31 per share (vs. expected $5.18). Epistrophy Capital Research chief market strategist Cory Johnson joins the Market Domination Overtime team to take a closer look at Adobe's quarterly results, full-year outlook, and business growth tied to AI tools. Johnson is also the host of The Drill Down podcast. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Adobe Gives Strong Outlook, Showing Payoff From AI Features
summary: Adobe has worked to weave artificial intelligence features, often based on its own generative models, into the company’s industry-standard products like Photoshop.  Annual recurring revenue from AI-influenced products has surpassed $5 billion, Chief Executive Officer Shantanu Narayen said in the statement.  “Adobe is the leader in the AI creative applications category,” he said.

headline: Adobe: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The average estimate of 13 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $5.17 per share. The software maker posted revenue of $5.99 billion in the period, also beating Street forecasts. Ten analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $5.9 billion.

raw.headline: Adobe: Fiscal Q3 Earnings Snapshot

headline: Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3
summary: Creative software giant Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 10.7% year on year to $5.99 billion. The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $6.1 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.31 per share was 2.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q3

The company expects next quarter’s revenue to be around $6.1 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $5.31 per share was 2.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Global Enterprises Embrace Adobe and its AI Innovations to Power Growth
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., September 11, 2025--Adobe (Nasdaq: ADBE) today announced the acceleration of its AI innovation adoption, with leading enterprises embracing Adobe to transform the way they work. Today, 99% of Fortune 100 companies have used AI in an Adobe app, and nearly 90% of the Top 50 enterprise accounts have adopted one or more of Adobe’s AI-first innovations including GenStudio for Performance Marketing, Firefly Services and Acrobat AI Assistant.

headline: Adobe Results Risk Cementing AI Loser Status as Stock Slides
summary: Wall Street expects full-year sales growth of nearly 10% — a solid rate of expansion, but one that would be the slowest for Adobe in over a decade.  Analysts see the pace receding every year through fiscal 2028, at a time when investors can target clearer AI winners like Oracle Corp. that are anticipating accelerating growth in the coming years.  The key headwind for Adobe is a world suffused with artificial intelligence applications that threaten to undermine its core business of making software for creative professionals.

raw.headline: Adobe Results Risk Cementing AI Loser Status as Stock Slides
raw.summary: Wall Street expects full-year sales growth of nearly 10% — a solid rate of expansion, but one that would be the slowest for Adobe in over a decade.  Analysts see the pace receding every year through fiscal 2028, at a time when investors can target clearer AI winners like Oracle Corp. that are anticipating accelerating growth in the coming years.  The key headwind for Adobe is a world suffused with artificial intelligence applications that threaten to undermine its core business of making software for creative professionals.

headline: E-Commerce Today - Global eCommerce Payments Soar Driven by Emerging Markets
summary: A recent study by Juniper Research forecasts that global eCommerce payments will surpass $13 trillion by 2030, reflecting a 57% increase from 2025. This growth is anticipated to be driven primarily by emerging markets, such as Latin America and the Indian Subcontinent, where access to local payment methods is enhancing eCommerce participation. The report emphasizes the critical role of identifying and supporting appropriate local payment solutions for international merchants and eCommerce...

headline: CPI inflation data, Oracle, Adobe: 3 Things
summary: Markets brace for August's Consumer Price Index, which is expected to show inflation remains sticky - and could influence the Fed's rate decision. The Oracle (ORCL) effect lifts stocks in Asia, with Softbank (SFTBY) soaring. Adobe (ADBE) shares stay in the doldrums ahead of a high-stakes earnings report.

headline: FUJIFILM Fully Unveils Powerful GFX ETERNA 55 8K Cinema Camera; First Look YouTube Video GFX ETERNA 55 Cinema Camera, More Info at B&H
summary: B&H is pleased to announce the internal specs, recording formats, Film Simulations modes, and more for FUJIFILM's GFX ETERNA 55 cinema camera. The GFX ETERNA 55 will utilize a massive 43.8 x 32.9mm 102MP CMOS II HS sensor and X-Processor 5 to capture footage in five primary formats—GF, Premista, 35mm, Anamorphic 35mm, and Super35mm—in resolutions up to DCI 8K. Codecs include ProRes 422, H.265, and H.264. The camera also supports twenty different Film Simulation modes.

raw.headline: FUJIFILM Fully Unveils Powerful GFX ETERNA 55 8K Cinema Camera; First Look YouTube Video GFX ETERNA 55 Cinema Camera, More Info at B&H

Codecs include ProRes 422, H.265, and H.264. The camera also supports twenty different Film Simulation modes.
